content: The 30-day yatra aims to engage citizens and showcase a vision for a reformed Kerala. Front leaders highlight financial distress, youth migration, and failing governance under the LDF, accusing the government of shielding gold smuggling suspects.

title: Thiruvananthapuram tops list of districts with most number of stray dog bites

title: ED summons actor Jayaram in Sabarimala gold theft case
content: The actor had then denied any wrongdoing and said he had no links with the company where the replating of gold-clad artefacts of the temple was done or its sponsors

title: Tadoba tiger that swam two rivers and crossed three States tranquilised in East Godavari
content: After a 53-day movement through forest corridors and inhabited areas, the transient male tiger is secured in a cattle shed at Kurmapuram village on Friday evening, forest officials say. They add that the animal does not attack any human during its long journey and is in stable condition, with a decision yet to be taken on shifting it to a zoo or a rescue centre

title: Will consider high-speed rail if State interested, says Union Minister
content: Union Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw says in Rajya Sabha that the SilverLine semi-high-speed rail project proposed by Kerala is not feasible as it will major environmental impact

title: 'Blew himself up after being stopped at gate': What we know about deadly blast in Pak
content: A devastating suicide bombing at a Shia mosque in Islamabad, Pakistan, claimed at least 31 lives and injured over 160 during Friday prayers. The attacker detonated himself after being stopped at the imambargah's gate. Authorities are investigating the incident, with initial reports suggesting foreign links. This attack follows recent violence in the region.

title: U19 WC Final: Sooryavanshi demolition job leads India to record sixth title
content: India U19 clinched their sixth ICC Under-19 World Cup title with a dominant 100-run win over England U19 at Harare Sports Club. Fourteen-year-old Vaibhav Sooryavanshi starred with 175 off 80 balls, the fastest 150 in U19 history. India posted 411/9, and despite Caleb Falconer‚Äôs 115, England fell short at 311, as India‚Äôs bowlers maintained control.

title: How Trump's claims on tariffs are far from reality
content: President Trump claims tariffs have created an "American economic miracle," but facts suggest a mixed reality. While GDP growth has been strong, data on inflation, stock market performance, and trade deficits often contradicts his optimistic pronouncements. Investment pledges, though substantial, are also subject to scrutiny and uncertainty.

title: ‚ÄòIn 36 months, the cheapest place to put AI will be ‚Ä¶‚Äô: Musk makes a bold prediction
content: Elon Musk predicts space will soon host the most cost-effective AI data centers, potentially within three years. He highlighted space's superior solar energy capture, lack of atmospheric interference, and absence of day-night cycles, eliminating the need for batteries. Musk also downplayed concerns about GPU reliability in large-scale AI training, suggesting they become dependable after initial debugging.

title: ‚ÄòNo limits, no transparency, no controls‚Äô: US accuses China of covert nuclear tests
content: The US has accused China of secretly conducting nuclear tests, urging Beijing to join arms control talks as the New START treaty expires. While Russia and the US acknowledge the need for urgent negotiations, China rejects the claims and refuses to participate, citing its smaller arsenal. This raises fears of a new nuclear arms race.

title: 'Proud of our team': PM Modi congratulates Team India after U19 World Cup victory
content: India‚Äôs U-19 cricket team clinched their sixth ICC U-19 World Cup title with a dominant 412-run total against England at Harare Sports Club. Fourteen-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi starred with 175 off 80 balls. Praises poured in from PM Modi, Vice-President CP Radhakrishnan, President Murmu, and Bihar CM Nitish Kumar. England fell short, giving India a historic, record-extending triumph.

title: Google CEO thinks bloodbath in markets in reaction to Anthropic is overblown
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai and Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang dismiss market panic over AI plugins, calling it overblown. Despite a significant selloff in software stocks triggered by Anthropic's legal AI tools, they argue AI will enhance, not replace, existing software, enabling greater productivity and innovation.

title: T20 WC: Harshit Rana ruled out of tournament; Siraj named replacement
content: India's Harshit Rana has been ruled out of the T20 World Cup 2026 due to a knee injury sustained during a warm-up match against South Africa. Mohammed Siraj has been named as his replacement. The BCCI confirmed Rana's unfitness after specialist assessment and scans.

title: Facebook parent Meta announces more layoffs at San Francisco office
content: Meta is cutting over 100 jobs in its San Francisco Peninsula offices, redirecting metaverse investment towards wearable technology. This move follows earlier reductions and a broader company strategy to become leaner and more productive, leveraging AI for increased output.

title: From Kohli to Mhatre: Check U19 WC winners list as India beat England
content: India U19 claimed their sixth ICC Under-19 World Cup title in 2026, defeating England U19 by 100 runs at Harare Sports Club. Vaibhav Sooryavanshi starred with 175 off 80 balls, while captain Ayush Mhatre and Kanishk Chouhan contributed crucial knocks. England‚Äôs chase faltered under consistent Indian bowling, handing India a dominant win and extending their rich U19 legacy.

title: US-Iran nuclear talks: Tehran strikes 'positive' note - what was discussed in Oman
content: Iran's foreign minister described mediated talks with the US in Oman as a "good start" for nuclear discussions, expressing optimism for a positive framework if the current path continues. Both sides agreed to further discussions, with Iran conveying its concerns and interests while the US seeks to address its missile program and regional support.

title: Super Bowl 2026: Date, Time, Channel, Anthem Singer & Bad Bunny Halftime Show
content: Super Bowl LX kicks off Sunday, Feb. 8, 2026, at 6:30 p.m. ET from Levi‚Äôs Stadium. Find out what channel is the Super Bowl on 2026, how to stream Patriots vs. Seahawks on Peacock and NFL+, how to watch in the UK, and where to catch Bad Bunny‚Äôs Super Bowl halftime show 2026 plus every pregame performance.

title: Chris Hemsworth‚Äôs Amazon Super Bowl stunt sparks backlash amid layoffs
content: Amazon employees were upset when actor Chris Hemsworth briefly appeared on an internal org chart as ‚ÄúChief Heartthrob‚Äù for a Super Bowl ad. Coming right after layoffs and weak earnings, the stunt felt tone deaf to many staffers. The listing was removed quickly.

title: Sonny Jurgensen‚Äôs net worth: A look at the late NFL icon‚Äôs earnings
content: Hall of Fame QB Sonny Jurgensen's net worth was around $2 million at his death. Explore how the NFL legend built his fortune through football and a successful four-decade broadcasting career.

title: Run over, bludgeoned, throat slit: Hyderabad lawyer murdered over land; brother ‚Äòpaid‚Äô killers
content: A land dispute tragically led to the murder of advocate G Swapna Kumari in Hyderabad. Her elder brother, G Raju, along with three associates, has been arrested. Raju allegedly orchestrated the attack, offering land to accomplices for eliminating his sister over a four-acre ancestral property. Police are investigating prior accident complaints filed by the victim against her brother.

title: Seven Naxals killed in Gadchiroli, including top leader; special force jawan succumbs to injuries
content: Seven Naxals, including top leader Prabhakar with a Rs 25 lakh bounty, were killed in an encounter with Maharashtra police in Gadchiroli. The operation, launched three days ago, also resulted in the death of a special force jawan, Deepak Chinna Madavi, while another jawan is out of danger. The anti-Naxal operation is ongoing.

title: 75+ happy rose day messages, greetings, wishes and quotes for 2026
content: February 7, 2026, marks Rose Day, initiating Valentine's Week. The article offers over 75 messages, quotes, and greetings for various relationships, emphasizing the symbolic meaning of rose colors.

title: Beyond Mumbai & Goa: How India‚Äôs tourism map is quietly changing
content: India's tourism landscape is rapidly evolving beyond beaches and hills. A new generation is flocking to spiritual and heritage sites like Ayodhya and Varanasi, driven by religious revival, infrastructure growth, and social media influence. These destinations are now vibrant, year-round hubs attracting diverse travellers seeking cultural immersion and authentic experiences.

title: What are OC and CC in real estate and why are these important
content: First-time homebuyers must understand the crucial roles of Completion Certificates (CC) and Occupancy Certificates (OC) in real estate. The CC verifies lawful construction as per approved plans, while the OC confirms a building's safety and readiness for habitation, ensuring legal occupancy and access to essential utilities.

title: How seven new high-speed rail corridors can transform train travel in India
content: The Union Budget 2026 announced seven high-speed rail corridors to enhance travel speed, safety, and comfort. The bullet trains, along with already operational Vande Bharat Sleeper and Amrit Bharat Express trains will improve connectivity and passenger experience.

title: Delhi biker's tragic death: Kin say got no help from cops; govt suspends 3 officials - key points
content: Three Delhi Jal Board engineers were suspended after a 25-year-old motorcyclist died falling into an unbarricaded construction pit. The victim's family alleged gross carelessness by the police in their search efforts, claiming they received no timely assistance. Authorities are investigating the incident and safety protocols.

title: Moon-bound again: 4 astronauts will fly farther than anyone since 1970s
content: Four astronauts are set for a 10-day deep-space journey aboard the Artemis II mission, marking humanity's return beyond low-Earth orbit after five decades. This lunar flyby will test new spacecraft and partnerships, validating crucial systems for future lunar landings and Mars missions. The mission prioritizes crew health and scientific observation, paving the way for sustained lunar exploration.

title: From Misbah's scoop, Brathwaite's sixes to Surya's catch: A T20 WC history
content: As the ICC Men‚Äôs T20 World Cup 2026 begins on Saturday across venues in India and Sri Lanka, the tournament marks another chapter in a competition that began 19 years ago. From its first edition in South Africa in 2007 to the 2024 event in the USA and Caribbean, the T20 World Cup has seen the format grow in scale and reach.

title: Sub-zero shock in Manali: Mumbai woman dies after sudden shivering during Solang Valley visit
content: A Mumbai tourist tragically died from suspected cold exposure in Manali's freezing Solang Valley. Meanwhile, Kullu witnessed a rare winter landslide, and avalanches pose a threat in higher altitudes.  A minor earthquake also rattled Kinnaur.  These events highlight the severe weather conditions gripping Himachal Pradesh.

title: K'taka CM row: DKS gets snarky after Sidda's son says no leadership change likely
content: Congress MLC Yathindra Siddaramaiah expressed confidence that his father, Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, will complete the full five-year term, citing a clear signal from the party high command. Deputy CM D.K. Shivakumar, however, responded sarcastically, suggesting the central leadership should clarify the matter. Speculation about a leadership change has intensified as the government nears its halfway mark

title: Bobby Wagner: NFL star and 2026 Walter Payton Man of the Year winner
content: Washington Commanders LB Bobby Wagner was named the Walter Payton NFL Man of the Year 2026 for his community work. The star credited his achievement to his mother. He established the FAST54 Phenia Mae Fund for stroke education and support, and later expanded it to include pediatric research. Wagner is also involved with initiatives related to social justice, mental health awareness, and tech education for underserved youth.

title: Hack of the day: Use WhatsApp without sharing your phone number publicly
content: Keep your personal phone number private on WhatsApp with these smart hacks. Utilize a secondary SIM or virtual number, or leverage the WhatsApp Business app. You can even link your account to a landline for enhanced privacy and to prevent unwanted contact.

title: Cooper DeJean breaks silence on Nikki Bella dating buzz after WWE Raw
content: Cooper DeJean finally addressed the rumors linking him to WWE star Nikki Bella. While appearing on The Pat McAfee Show, he stated that he does not have a public relationship, and later called Bella a good friend on Kay Adams‚Äô show.

title: Watch: Sooryavanshi's animated celebration goes viral in U19 WC final
content: Fourteen-year-old Vaibhav Sooryavanshi produced a breathtaking knock in the U-19 World Cup final, smashing the second-fastest century in tournament history off just 55 balls against England. He went on to score 175, dominating the bowlers, sharing a huge partnership, and earning a standing ovation for one of the greatest U-19 innings ever.

title: U19 WC final: Sooryavanshi smashes 55-ball century, puts India in command
content: Vaibhav Sooryavanshi smashed a blistering 55-ball century in the Under-19 World Cup final against England, setting a new record for most sixes in the tournament. His explosive innings, featuring eight fours and as many sixes, helped India post a strong total after winning the toss and electing to bat.

title: 'People laughed & made fun of me': 19-yr-old farmer shares how he fought odds to become model
content: Hailing from Aligarh, Nitin Kumar defied village expectations to pursue a modeling dream. Facing ridicule and financial hardship, he juggled multiple jobs, from security guard to airport worker, to fund his aspirations. Through relentless practice and social media vlogs, Nitin eventually landed his first paid shows, proving that perseverance can overcome humble beginnings and societal doubts.

title: Prakash Raj slams Kangana Ranaut's remarks on AR Rahman
content: Prakash Raj defended AR Rahman against Kangana Ranaut's criticism, highlighting the music maestro's achievements and questioning the backlash. Ranaut had accused Rahman of being prejudiced and hateful after he refused to compose for her film 'Emergency', which she called a masterpiece. Rahman later clarified his intentions were to uplift through music.

title: Use AI for guidance, not dependency, says PM Modi at Pariksha Pe Charcha 2026
content: At Pariksha Pe Charcha 2026, Prime Minister Narendra Modi described Artificial Intelligence as a helpful tool for students but warned against overdependence. He said AI can guide learning, such as recommending biographies, but cannot replace effort or discipline. Emphasising responsible use, he urged students to combine technology with critical thinking and active study habits.

title: Stock market: Here are the top gainers and losers on NSE, BSE today - check list
content: Indian equity markets closed higher Friday, with the Sensex and Nifty gaining ground. The Reserve Bank of India maintained interest rates and proposed allowing banks to lend to REITs, a move expected to boost the real estate sector. Despite a volatile session, late buying in select stocks, particularly FMCG and private banking, drove the recovery.

title: Manipur erupts in protest after MLA Nemcha Kipgen joins NDA govt as deputy CM
content: Protests erupted in Manipur's Churachandpur after Kuki-Zo MLA Nemcha Kipgen accepted a deputy CM role, sparking backlash. The Kuki Zo Council declared a social boycott of community legislators joining the government. Burning tyres and road blockades signaled renewed unrest, with calls for a shutdown in Kuki Zo-majority areas.

title: 14-year-old Rohingya boy taunted over ‚Äòrefugee‚Äô status, stabbed to death after quarrel in Delhi
content: A 14-year-old Rohingya boy died after being stabbed multiple times in Delhi's Khajuri Khas following an argument. The victim's father reported that the altercation began when a group allegedly hurled "refugee" slurs at his son and his friends. Four teenagers have been arrested in connection with the incident.

title: Travis Kelce loses major NFL honor as retirement rumors swirl
content: Travis Kelce didn‚Äôt end up winning the Walter Payton NFL Man of the Year Award at NFL Honors, despite being the Chiefs‚Äô nominee. The honor went to Commanders linebacker Bobby Wagner, who delivered an emotional speech thanking his parents. Kelce‚Äôs loss comes at a time when retirement rumors grow, and a decision hasn‚Äôt been made by the tight end.

title: Beyond The Frontlines: How Kyiv Is Moving The War Into Russia's Backyard
content: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its fourth year, the battlefield is no longer confined to drones and missile strikes along the frontlines. A series of assassinations on Russian soil suggests that a separate conflict is being fought far from borders.

title: Woman Sets Her Rs 2.5 Lakh E-Rickshaw On Fire After Firm Refuses Repairs
content: Enraged after months of alleged harassment and refusal by the company and showroom to repair her repeatedly malfunctioning e-rickshaw, a young woman set her Rs 2.5 lakh vehicle on fire right outside the very agency from which she had bought it.

title: Officials In Bengal Made To Fear For Their Lives: Poll Body To Supreme Court
content: Flagging what it termed a grave threat to its officials in West Bengal, the Election Commission of India has filed an application in the Supreme Court seeking a change in its January 19 order issuing directions to the poll body and the state governme

title: "Disgusting Behaviour": Trump Slammed For Video Of Obamas Depicted As Apes
content: US President Donald Trump was slammed after he posted a video on social media depicting former President Barack Obama and former First Lady Michelle Obama as apes.

title: Man, 25, Was Minutes From Home For Parents' Anniversary Before Fatal Accident
content: Call centre employee Kamal Dhyani's parents were waiting for him to come home from work so that they could begin celebrations for their wedding anniversary.

title: Indian Man Harassed Over Religion At Trade Event In Riyadh, Sparks Outrage
content: A video from a trade event in Saudi Arabia's Riyadh has sparked widespread outrage after a man was harassed for exhibiting an Indian company and derided the booth for belonging to a "Hindu".

title: Tirupati Laddoo Had Chemical Used To Clean Toilets: Chandrababu Naidu's New Allegation
content: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu on Friday alleged that Tirupati laddus (consecrated sweet) were made using ghee which was adulterated with "chemicals used to clean bathrooms" during the previous YSRCP government.

title: Adani Group Rolls Out Rs 70,000 Crore Investment Roadmap For Vidarbha
content: The Adani Group on Friday outlined a Rs 70,000 crore long-term investment roadmap for Vidarbha, across energy, infrastructure, logistics, aviation, and community development.

title: On Camera, Man Crushed To Death As Container Falls Off Truck In Gujarat
content: A man was crushed to death on Friday when a container fell off a truck in Gujarat's Valsad and landed on a makeshift structure where he was eating.

title: 25 Meghalaya Deaths Puts Focus On Illegal Rat Hole Mining And Its Dangers
content: At least 25 labourers were killed on Thursday morning in a suspected dynamite explosion at an illegal coal mine in Meghalaya's East Jaintia Hills district.

title: 14 New Self-Bag Drop Counters Go Live At Mumbai Airport
content: The "airport sprint" might finally be over. In a major move to eliminate terminal bottlenecks, Mumbai Airport has inaugurated 14 cutting-edge hybrid self-bag drop counters at Terminal 2.

title: Iran Shows Optimism On US Talks, Backs India Ties Ahead Of BRICS Visit
content: Iran's Ambassador to India, Dr Mohammad Fathali, said Tehran remains engaged in talks with the United States in Oman on the nuclear issue, while firmly rejecting suggestions of a broader negotiation framework.

title: "My Father Will Remain Chief Minister For 5 Years": Siddaramaiah's Son
content: The leadership tussle has resurfaced in Karnataka, with Chief Minister Siddaramaiah's son and Congress MLC Yathindra Siddaramaiah claiming that demands for a leadership change have not been accepted by the party high command.

title: Pakistan Blast Live Updates: Suspicion Likely To Fall On Pak Taliban, Islamic State
content: At least 69 people were killed, and 169 were injured after a suicide bomber detonated himself inside a shrine in Pakistan's capital, Islamabad.

title: NDTV Profit Conclave To Discuss 'India: The Real Deal' With Nirmala Sitharaman, Piyush Goyal
content: As India steps into one of the most consequential chapters of its economic story, NDTV Profit will host the NDTV Profit Conclave 2026 - India: The Real Deal. The conclave is scheduled for tomorrow in New Delhi.

title: Student Assaulted, Massive Bruises On Back In Bengal Medical College Ragging
content: A ragging incident has left a first-year student with serious injuries at a government medical college in West Bengal. The incident occurred at the Purulia Government Medical College and Hospital on February 1.

title: Surat Builder Shoots Self, Then Dies Of Heart Attack On Daughter's Wedding Day
content: A noted realtor from Surat has died of a heart attack days after a suicide attempt ahead of his daughter's wedding.

title: 69 Killed, 169 Injured In Suicide Bombing At Shrine In Islamabad
content: At least 69 people were killed and many were injured after a suicide bomber detonated himself inside a shrine in Pakistan's capital, Islamabad. The explosion occurred at Tarlai Imambargah, situated in the Shehzad Town area of the city.

title: US, Iran Holds Talks In Oman After Trump Military Threats
content: Iran and the United States were holding talks in Oman on Friday that were seen as a critical chance to avert any new escalation between the foes, after President Donald Trump threatened military action.

title: Russia, US To Start Negotiations To Renew Nuclear Treaty Soon: Kremlin
content: Russia and the United States agree that it is necessary to renew nuclear talks, the Kremlin said Friday, after the last treaty limiting Moscow's and Washington's arsenals expired.

title: Top Maoist couple carrying ‚Çπ1 crore reward surrender in Odisha; 19 Maoists lay down arms
content: Odisha Police say Left Wing Extremism waning as CPI (Maoist) cadres surrender in Rayagada; weapons seized

title: Electricity Regulatory Commission proposes ‚Äòautomatic compensation mechanism‚Äô for power distribution licencees such as KSEB
content: The consumer shall be automatically compensated, without the need for any claim, upon automatic identification of a default in the performance of the distribution licensee in parameters such as power failure, say draft regulations

title: Kerala government reiterates stand against NPR; issues fresh notification ahead of Census
content: According to the Chief Minister‚Äôs Office, the notification has been issued to remove any ambiguity amid speculation that the NPR could be conducted along with the Census exercise

title: SCTIMST organising MedTech Ideathon on February 21
content: Event meant for UG/PG students in science, engineering, medical, dental or paramedical streams, who may have an inclination for medical technology

title: Kerala HC directs imposing of fine on unauthorised boards, banners in public spaces
content: Court directs joint secretaries of Local Self-Government department to conduct special drives to remove unauthorised hoardings

title: Will explore all legal avenues to expose ‚ÄòJungle Raj‚Äô in Andhra Pradesh, says Jagan Mohan Reddy
content: Contrary to Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu‚Äôs claims, the court-monitored CBI investigation has conclusively established that there is no animal fat in the ghee used for preparing Tirumala laddu, asserts the YSRCP chief

title: Anomie movie review: Bhavana‚Äôs sci-fi thriller failed by too many derivative elements
content: For long portions, the screenplay meanders along without any eventful turns. Consequently, the film fails to be engaging except in the latter portions of the investigation

title: Tension prevails as villagers block forest officials‚Äô entry to Kolleru Lake
content: Opposing demolition drive against illegal fish tanks, residents say that they will continue to protest till the boundary disputes of the sanctuary is resolved

title: Government ropes in students for governance feedback through college consultations
content: Institutions have been instructed to conduct student group discussions to collect suggestions and ideas related to governance and development

title: AICC caught in a tangle as MPs seek Assembly seats
content: With at least half a dozen MPs expressing interest in State politics, the AICC seeks to balance organisational stability in Parliament against the demand to field leaders with local clout to counter LDF and revive the UDF‚Äôs electoral fortunes

title: Dewaswom Board initiates comprehensive changes in Sabarimala pilgrimage
content: A separate Budget will be prepared exclusively for the festival, in addition to the TDB‚Äôs general Budget; Special training will be given to all Devaswom employees who will be part of Sabarimala duty in the months of August and September

title: CM will decide bifurcation of Belagavi district: Satish Jarkiholi
content: Public Works Minister Satish Jarkiholi says that any decision on bifurcation of Belagavi district will have to be taken by Chief Minister Siddaramaiah

title: Mineral-rich A.P. stands to gain from Rare Earth Corridor plan, says official
content: State has the mineral deposits spread in about 16,000 hectares, of which superior quality minerals have been identified mostly in Visakhapatnam and Srikakulam districts, according to APMDC vice-chairman and MD Pravin Kumar

title: Bengal‚Äôs SIR hearing woes¬†continue as voters line up at centres
content: Both voters¬†and election officials are racing against time, amid widespread confusion over surname variations, clerical¬†errors¬†and automated system-generated notices¬†

title: Students take the lead as Great Backyard Bird Count 2026 returns to campuses
content: Campus Bird Count to run alongside global event from February 13‚Äì16; organisers expect wider participation after last year‚Äôs record engagement

title: ‚ÄòAksharam Aarogyam‚Äô programme launched in Kollam
content: Aimed at students from Classes I to XII in all government and aided schools across the State, objective of the project is to ensure early intervention and systematic health monitoring for the younger generation

title: CM, DCM to initiate ‚Çπ200 crore Benni Halla flood control project on Feb. 8
content: ‚ÄòThe ‚Çπ200 crore project has been prepared as per the recommendations of the G. Paramashivaiah Committee on preventing flash floods and mitigating the losses‚Äô

title: ED attaches properties worth ‚Çπ16.35 crore in BHEL housing society cheating case
content: The society collected about ‚Çπ18.09 crore from 316 members for allotment of residential plots and construction of houses but office bearers allegedly diverted and misappropriated funds in conspiracy with the builder

title: Seven more bodies recovered, death toll in Meghalaya coal mine blast mounts to 25
content: So far, seven additional bodies have been recovered today, taking the total number of deaths to 25. Out of these, 12 bodies have been identified, says Director General of Police I Nongrang

title: Bengaluru metro fare revision sparks political slugfest
content: A zone-wise fare revision with fares rising by ‚Çπ1‚Äì‚Çπ5 across 10 zones will come into effect from February 9

title: Ravichandra takes over as TTD Executive Officer
content: After taking oath, the official has assured coordinated efforts with the TTD Board to enhance pilgrim-friendly services

title: Kochi Corporation warns of ‚Çπ5,000 fine for unauthorised flex boards and banners
content: The Corporation issued the directive after noticing several such unauthorised installations at various locations within its limits

title: Kerala‚Äôs adopted daughter Pepita Seth becomes an Indian citizen at 84
content: The acclaimed writer and photographer has a decades-long bond with Kerala whose rituals, art and everyday life she documented for the world. A journey that began long ago and culminated in national recognition with the Padma Shri in 2012 now comes a full circle.

title: 2026 Pro Football Hall of Fame: Meet the new members

title: 2026 NFL Honors: Who won the league's biggest awards?
content: the best of the NFL gathered at the Palace of Fine Arts in San Francisco for Thursday's Super Bowl honors . the Seattle Seahawks and new England Patriots meet at Levi's Stadium in Santa Clara, California, for super bowl lX . quarterback Matthew Stafford won the biggest prize -- MVP .

title: Barnwell‚Äôs annual SB opus: We size up every facet of Seahawks-Pats and pick the winner
content: the Seattle Seahawks and new England Patriots meet in super bowl lX on sunday . the game has become battlefields between teams trying to create and prevent explosive plays . defenses have leaned into Vic Fangio-style philosophies and continued to raise their rates of two-high safety looks .
